diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can affect multiple systems including the skin, kidneys, and brain. Presents with fever, malar rash, proteinuria, and can cause neuropsychiatric symptoms including delirium.

diagnoses.name: Dermatomyositis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease marked by muscle weakness and skin rash, including an erythematous-violaceous rash. It may present with fever, rash, and systemic symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Vasculitis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of the blood vessels that can cause a range of symptoms, including rash, fever, and organ involvement leading to a variety of symptoms including delirium and proteinuria.

diagnoses.name: Infectious Endocarditis
diagnoses.description: An infection of the heart valves or inner lining of the heart. Symptoms can include fever, heart murmur, petechial rash, and in severe cases might cause delirium due to septic emboli or metabolic disturbances.

diagnoses.name: Mixed Connective Tissue Disease (MCTD)
diagnoses.description: A disease with features of several connective tissue diseases including SLE, polymyositis, and scleroderma. It can present with fever, rash, and renal involvement.

diagnoses.name: Lupus Nephritis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of the kidneys caused by Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE). It may present with proteinuria, hematuria, and can cause symptoms related to lupus including fever and rash.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatic Fever
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease that can develop after a Group A Streptococcus infection. It can affect the heart, joints, skin, and brain, leading to symptoms like fever, arthritis, erythema marginatum, and in severe cases, Sydenham's chorea.

diagnoses.name: Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever
diagnoses.description: A tick-borne illness caused by Rickettsia rickettsii. It presents with fever, headache, rash, and can progress to serious complications, including delirium, especially if not treated promptly.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that attacks the glands that produce saliva and tears. It can present with systemic features including rash, renal involvement, and fever, especially in secondary Sjögren's syndrome where there is an association with other autoimmune diseases.

diagnoses.name: Henoch-Schönlein Purpura
diagnoses.description: An immune-mediated vasculitis that typically presents with palpable purpura, abdominal pain, arthritis, and renal involvement, including proteinuria. It may occasionally have systemic symptoms like fever.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can cause inflammation and damage to joints, skin, kidneys, heart, lungs, blood vessels, and brain.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diagnoses.description: A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet, potentially causing joint damage and deformities.

diagnoses.name: Evans Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare autoimmune disorder where the body's immune system produces antibodies that attack the red cells, white cells, and/or platelets.

diagnoses.name: Antiphospholipid Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder characterized by the body's response to certain blood proteins, leading to blood clots and other complications.

diagnoses.name: Viral Infections
diagnoses.description: Certain viral infections can cause a combination of these symptoms through immune system activation or direct tissue damage.

diagnoses.name: Mixed Connective Tissue Disease
diagnoses.description: A disorder featuring a combination of signs and symptoms of connective tissue diseases like SLE, scleroderma, and polymyositis.

diagnoses.name: Adult Still's Disease
diagnoses.description: A rare type of inflammatory arthritis characterized by fever, rash, and joint pain. It may also affect other organs.

diagnoses.name: Sarcoidosis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease characterized by tiny clumps of inflammatory cells in various parts of the body, potentially affecting organ function.

diagnoses.name: Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis (HLH)
diagnoses.description: A rare disease causing the immune system to damage the body's tissues, leading to a severe systemic inflammatory response.

diagnoses.name: Parvovirus B19 Infection
diagnoses.description: Parvovirus B19 can cause erythema infectiosum (fifth disease) in children and can lead to serious complications in adults, including autoimmune hemolytic anemia and arthropathy.

diagnoses: Autoimmune Connective Tissue Diseases (e.g., Lupus, Rheumatoid Arthritis)

symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses: Secondary thrombocytosis due to inflammatory or infectious disorder
Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS)

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.description: A condition in which your thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones.
common_symptoms: pain, stiffness or swelling in your joints
heavier than normal or irregular menstrual periods

diagnoses.name: Diabetes mellitus
diagnoses.description: A group of diseases that affect how your body uses blood sugar (glucose).
common_symptoms: presence of ketones in the urine
darkening of skin in armpits and neck

diagnoses.name: Menopause
diagnoses.description: A natural biological process that marks the end of your menstrual cycles. It's diagnosed after you've gone 12 months without a menstrual period.

diagnoses.name: Chronic kidney disease
diagnoses.description: A long-term condition where the kidneys don't work as well as they should.

diagnoses.name: Depression
diagnoses.description: A mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest. Also called major depressive disorder or clinical depression.
common_symptoms: loss of interest in most or all normal activities
slowed thinking, speaking or body movements
trouble thinking, concentrating, making decisions and remembering things
frequent or recurrent thoughts of death, suicidal thoughts

diagnoses.name: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS)
diagnoses.description: A hormonal disorder common among women of reproductive age.

diagnoses.name: Hypopituitarism
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder in which your pituitary gland fails to produce one or more of its hormones, or doesn't produce enough of them.

diagnoses.name: Iron deficiency anemia
diagnoses.description: A common type of anemia, a condition in which blood lacks adequate healthy red blood cells.
common_symptoms: chest pain, fast heartbeat or shortness of breath
inflammation or soreness of your tongue
unusual cravings for non-nutritive substances, such as ice, dirt or starch
an uncomfortable tingling or crawling feeling in your legs (restless legs syndrome)

diagnoses.name: Fibromyalgia
diagnoses.description: A condition that causes pain all over the body (also referred to as widespread pain), sleep problems, fatigue, and often emotional and mental distress.

diagnoses.name: Anxiety disorders
diagnoses.description: A group of mental health disorders that includes generalised anxiety disorder, social anxiety disorder, specific phobias, and others.
common_symptoms: having a sense of impending danger, panic or doom
trouble concentrating or thinking about anything other than the present worry
having the urge to avoid things that trigger anxiety

diagnoses: Underlying Cardiac Condition leading to Kounis Syndrome
Secondary Immunodeficiencies (due to medications, malignancies, etc.)

symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
diagnoses.rationale: Bronchitis is a common symptom of COPD, a progressive lung disease that can also lead to symptoms like anxiety due to difficulty breathing.

diagnoses.name: Anxiety Disorders
diagnoses.rationale: Anxiety and obsessive-compulsive behavior are key symptoms of various anxiety disorders, which can worsen with physical health issues.

diagnoses.name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
diagnoses.rationale: Characterized by obsessive-compulsive behavior, OCD may coexist with other conditions such as anxiety and stress-related disorders.

diagnoses.name: Allergic Rhinitis
diagnoses.rationale: Allergic rhinitis could cause irritated eyes and is sometimes associated with bronchitis due to postnasal drip; it might also increase anxiety due to discomfort.

diagnoses.name: Angioedema
diagnoses.rationale: Angioedema itself, an allergic reaction that can cause rapid swelling, sometimes including the eyes, and could be related to an underlying allergy.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Angioedema
diagnoses.rationale: A genetic form of angioedema that might not have an obvious allergic trigger but presents with similar symptoms, including recurrent episodes of severe swelling.

diagnoses.name: Asthma
diagnoses.rationale: Chronic inflammatory disease of the airways that can cause symptoms such as bronchitis, and may aggravate conditions like anxiety due to breathing difficulties.

diagnoses.name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)
diagnoses.rationale: Characterized by persistent and excessive worry about various things, including health, which could exacerbate or be exacerbated by other medical conditions.

diagnoses.name: Depression
diagnoses.rationale: Depression and anxiety often co-occur, and symptoms like obsessive-compulsive behavior can also be present in severe cases.

diagnoses.name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
diagnoses.rationale: PTSD can manifest with anxiety, obsessive thoughts or behaviors, and physical symptoms such as irritable eyes or exacerbated bronchitis due to stress.

diagnoses: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (e.g., Crohn's Disease, Ulcerative Colitis)

diagnoses.name: Allergic Rhinitis
diagnoses.description: An allergy-related condition that leads to sneezing, congestion, and runny nose. It can sometimes lead to wheezing, especially in those with asthma.

diagnoses.name: Asthma
diagnoses.description: A common long-term inflammatory disease of the airways of the lungs. It is characterized by variable and recurring symptoms, reversible airflow obstruction, and easily triggered bronchospasms. Symptoms include episodes of wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, and shortness of breath or dyspnea.

diagnoses.name: Gastroenteritis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of the gastrointestinal tract, involving both the stomach and the small intestine. Symptoms may include diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal cramps.

diagnoses.name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
diagnoses.description: An infection in any part of the urinary system. It often causes frequent urination, a strong urge to urinate, and might lead to incontinence in some cases. Could potentially be linked with abdominal cramps.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
diagnoses.description: A chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs. Symptoms include breathing difficulty, cough, mucus (sputum) production, and wheezing. It is typically caused by long-term exposure to irritating gases or particulate matter.

diagnoses.name: Food Allergies
diagnoses.description: An immune system reaction that occurs soon after eating a certain food. Symptoms can include digestive problems, hives, or swollen airways, and in some cases may lead to wheezing or shortness of breath.

diagnoses.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
diagnoses.description: A group of intestinal symptoms that typically occur together. Symptoms can include cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhea or constipation, or both.

diagnoses.name: Anaphylaxis
diagnoses.description: A severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction. It can cause a range of symptoms, including a rash, low pulse, and shock, with severe cases resulting in dyspnea and wheezing due to constriction of the airways.

diagnoses.name: Interstitial Cystitis
diagnoses.description: A chronic condition causing bladder pressure, bladder pain, and sometimes pelvic pain, ranging from mild discomfort to severe. This syndrome can lead to a feeling of urgency and, in some cases, incontinence.

diagnoses.name: Pneumonia
diagnoses.description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid or pus. Symptoms can include cough with phlegm or pus, fever, chills, and difficulty breathing.

diagnoses: Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease, Ulcerative colitis)
Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease, Ulcerative colitis)
Inflammatory Bowel Disease (e.g., Crohn’s Disease, Ulcerative Colitis)
Drug reactions (including allergic and non-allergic drug reactions)

diagnoses.name: Allergic Rhinitis
diagnoses.description: An allergy-related condition that occurs when your body's immune system overreacts to substances in the environment, leading to symptoms such as sneezing, nasal congestion, and itchy eyes or skin.

diagnoses.name: Urticaria (Hives)
diagnoses.description: A skin reaction that results in itchy welts, which can be triggered by factors such as allergies, stress or certain medications. Angioedema can also accompany urticaria, affecting deeper layers of the skin.

diagnoses.name: Anaphylaxis
diagnoses.description: A severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that can cause angioedema, pruritus, and respiratory symptoms. Immediate medical attention is needed.

diagnoses.name: Common Cold
diagnoses.description: A viral respiratory infection causing symptoms including sneezing and nasal congestion. Does not typically cause incontinence or significant angioedema.

diagnoses.name: Influenza
diagnoses.description: A viral infection affecting the respiratory system, leading to symptoms such as nasal congestion and sneezing, but usually accompanied by fever, aches, and fatigue.

diagnoses.name: Atopic Dermatitis
diagnoses.description: A condition causing itchy inflammation of the skin (pruritus), which could be exacerbated by nasal allergies. However, it doesn't usually cause incontinence.

diagnoses.name: Drug Allergy
diagnoses.description: An immune system reaction to a drug that can result in various symptoms, including rash, hives (pruritus), and in severe cases, anaphylaxis with angioedema.

diagnoses.name: Contact Dermatitis
diagnoses.description: A type of inflammation of the skin that occurs when substances touching your skin cause irritation or allergic reaction, leading to itching and rash.

diagnoses.name: Food Allergy
diagnoses.description: An adverse health effect arising from a specific immune response that occurs reproducibly on exposure to a given food, which can cause symptoms including angioedema and pruritus.

diagnoses.name: Stress Incontinence
diagnoses.description: A condition in which there is involuntary leakage of urine during activities that increase abdominal pressure, such as coughing, sneezing, or exercising. Often unrelated to the above allergic reactions or respiratory conditions but can co-occur.

diagnoses: Urticaria (Chronic idiopathic, physical, or other types)
Toxic effects of substances (e.g., alcohol, drugs)
Primary Angiitis of the Central Nervous System
Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS Syndrome)
Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS Syndrome)
